page.title: 16Local Interview
page.content: {Q. What do you think are the {advantages of going to Pocklington {School rather than Woldgate School?} A. The boarders at Pocklington School have to conform to stricter discipline than the day boys, and they have more time to deal with all sorts of extra curricular activity. They are often better equipped in life to face its rigours, particularly in such events as the Falklands Crisis three years ago. They are often stronger and tougher in dealing with nasty situations, than perhaps pupils of Woldgate School. {Q. Are pupils encouraged to integrate {into the town community?} A. While there is nothing put in their way to prevent this, there are so many things going on at the school that there is little opportunity for them to integrate in the proper sense.
